snippet: A number of misleading statements were made by both candidates in Wednesday’s debate on subjects like the federal deficits, taxes, Medicare and health care.
abstract: Check Point column takes a look at statements made by both Mitt Romney and Pres Obama in their first debate of the presidential race, analyzing claims and counterclaims made during the evening.

byline.original: By MICHAEL COOPER, JACKIE CALMES, ANNIE LOWREY, ROBERT PEAR and JOHN M. BRODER

lead_paragraph: A number of misleading statements were made by both candidates in Wednesday’s debate on subjects like the federal deficits, taxes, Medicare and health care.

headline.print_headline: Taking Stock of Some of the Claims and Counterclaims
headline.seo: A Closer Look at What the Presidential Candidates Said in the Debate
headline.main: Taking Stock of Some of the Claims and Counterclaims

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
